page.title: 01The Harbour Area, Guernsey
page.content: Although mostly sea this block does have in it a narrow East coast strip of the island of Guernsey that includes the harbour of St.Peter Port. As well as serving the basic needs of trade and tourist transport the harbour boasts two yacht marinas, with a third under construction. Guarding the entrance to the port is the eight hundred year old Castle Cornet, whilst the Roman wreck recently rescued from the harbour mouth, is also of considerable historical importance. The main source of employment in the area is for harbour staff, dockers and fishermen. The Guernsey Yacht Club provides recreational facilities and the nearby Aquarium is a place of interest that attracts many visitors during wet weather.
